name: Aashray Promotion of Social Enterprises Foundation
Details of Achievements: The goal of Aashray Incubator is to create replicable models for technical and business incubation for technological and social entrepreneurs who have products and services that will materially benefit the people at median and bottom of the pyramid levels. Its objectives are: - Provide a platform for setting-up of appropriate, sustainable and scalable technological and social enterprises. - Identify innovative business ideas and entrepreneurs, including those that have evolved in not-for-profit organisations, academic institutions, and R&D institutions for setting up techno social business ventures as incubatees. - Provide optimal incubation support to incubatees, including through collaboration and networking with other entities in the incubation ecosystem. - Collaborate with financing institutions, funders/ donors and individuals for funding start-ups/ accelerators supported by Aashray. - Strengthen/ build the Aashray Endowment Fund through CSR contributions and donations from HNIs/ others to make available seed capital for innovations or ideas that may otherwise be shelved due to inadequacy or lack of funding. - Nurture and provide consultancy support for setting-up of Aashray incubation model/ incubation eco-systems to promote the start-up movement in India. - Develop appropriate infrastructure including state-of-the-art transitional R&D laboratories and equipment through collaborations. - Build alliances with government agencies, incubators, industry and academia internationally to create an enabling and inclusive ecosystem for techno-social business start-ups.

Key Issues.Key Issues: Agriculture,Biotechnology,Housing,Micro Small & Medium Enterprises,Science & Technology,Any Other

Source of Funds.Purpose: The Ministry of Minority Affairs with World Bank assistance is implementing Nai Manzil - an integrated education and skill development scheme for the Minority youth. Nai Manzil aims to engage constructively with poor minority youth and help them to get sustainable and gainful employment.We have been sanctioned training for 970 candidates in the state of Gujarat for Nai Manzil

The scheme   aims at  upgrading  the skills of the  minority  youths in various  modern/traditional  vocations depending upon their educational qualification, present economic trends and the market potential, which can earn them a suitable employment or make them  suitably skilled  to go for self-employment.Under this project, we were assigned to train 300 candidates for the year 2014-15

name: AHMEDABAD STUDY ACTION GROUP
Details of Achievements: CHILDLINE is a nationwide emergency helpline for children in distress; Indiaâ€™s first 24-hour helpline reaching out to the most marginalized children with the aim of providing rescue and relief, rehabilitation and repatriation, emotional sustenance and guidance. It is a project supported by the Ministry of Women and Child Development (GOI), working in partnership with state Governments, NGOâ€™s, and International Organizations, the Corporate Sector, Concerned individuals and Children. CHILDLINE Ahmedabad was setup in the year 2000 and is being run by Ahmedabad Study Action Group since its inception; the nodal organization being Gujarat Vidyapith.  Some of the activities are  1. Rescuing a child in the following process - The incoming call to 1098 is received by a trained team member who responds to the emergency depending on the nature of the call. In case the team member realizes he/she will not be able to reach the child in time, they seek assistance from a support organization in the vicinity of the caller. Emergency rescue is followed by conversing with the child to acquire information and linking him/her to medical help, shelter, rehabilitation, repatriation, protection from abuse or intensive counseling as per requirement. This process involves networking with existing organizations that provide specialized services. Every child rescued is pursued by the respective CHILDLINE team member for 6 months to ensure his/her wellbeing. 2. Creating awareness about Childline â€“ ASAG has initiated a 2 year plan to cover all the slums in Ahmedabad to create awareness.   3. Building network of volunteers

Source of Funds.Purpose: This scheme provides timely seed fund support to deserving startups thereby enabling them to take their venture to the next level by facilitating adequate go-to-market execution. The support extended under this scheme is upto INR 50 lakh.

Entrepreneurs-in- Residence (EIR) Programme is one of the programs introduced under NIDHI to inspire the best talents to be entrepreneurs, to minimise the risk involved in pursuing start- ups, and to partially set off their opportunity costs of high paying jobs.

The Scheme offers upto INR30 lakh for Eligible Innovative Entrepreneurs for product development, marketing, and professional assistance. VentureStudio enables startups to apply to the Scheme and assists them to avail the Grant.

name: All India Disaster Mitigation Institute
Details of Achievements: All India Disaster Mitigation Institute, AIDMI, Ahmedabad, India is a registered national organization which is among the pioneers in the area of disaster mitigation. It is  community based action research and action advocacy organization that has been working towards bridging the gap between policy, practice and research, in disaster management since 1995. AIDMIâ€™s mission is to reduce the vulnerability of poor communities by increasing, mitigation efforts, through learning and action to ensure water, habitat, food and work and so human security. The organization has a local presence with global interest and work. AIDMI has expanded its work over the years to cover various types of natural as well as manmade disasters in many parts of India and beyond. AIDMI works towards promoting disaster mitigation by supporting, capturing, processing and disseminating disaster related information, lessons and innovative ideas as well as conducting trainings, round tables and workshops.   AIDMI has worked in different areas of disaster management including risk reduction, knowledge management, Disaster Response and policy advocacy. The focus of AIDMI has always been to reduce disaster risk to poor, vulnerable communities, both through integrating risk reduction measures with disaster recovery and by encouraging people living in hazard-prone areas to take disaster risk mitigation approaches. AIDMI is working with partners in 9 Asian countries on Climate Change and DRR issues, and directly working in 7 states of India. It has directly supported   more than 14,000 disaster affected victims for tailor made livelihood relief, supported more than 8000 persons to temporary or permanent or repairing of their shelter.  More than 3500 members were covered through disaster insurance under Risk transfer initiative. It has trained 5600 school teachers/students, covered 40,000 students, teachers and school staff under school insurance, conducted 126 trainings and 1500 schools under childâ€™s right to safer school campaign. It is reaching to 30,000 readers across the globe through its web-based English publication Southasiadisaters.net, reaching to 10,000 national readers through its Hindi publication and to 7750 readers of Gujarat through Gujarati Publication. Apart from this it has conducted 25 regional / national training courses and trained 525 participants of  civil society organizations, government, Universities and organizations working for DRR, conducted 375 local capacity building cycles and trained more than 11826 community members in local languages. 86 interns from all over the world from came to AIDMI for applying their knowledge to work.

name: anartfoundation
Details of Achievements: About Anart Foundation  Established with a view to generate and extend awareness for classical dance and related arts, Anart Foundation is engaged in wide ranging activities from creating and staging dance productions, imparting performance oriented training to working on research oriented projects.  Anart Foundation has flourished and bloomed as an institution of high repute with the creative excellence and vision of gurus Maulik Shah and Ishira Parikh. Maulik Shah and Ishira Parikh are two of the most recognized and established kathak dancers and choreographers of this generation. Even though both are virtuous dancers in their own right, together they create unique fusion of complementary artistic vision. Not only as dancers, but also as choreographers they have displayed their creative excellence. They have performed at all reputed events and festivals of India. They have been cultural ambassadors to as many as 35 countries around the world. They are on the panel of ICCR in outstanding category since many years. They are top grade artist in Doordarshan and are recipients of prestigious awards like Gaurav puraskar, Guj. State, Navdeep puraskar, shringarmani etc  Anart Foundation has created and staged many dance productions which have proved to be innovative, creative and of high caliber.  Anart dance ensemble has shaped into one of the leading performing company of India. Talented dancers groomed under the tutelage of Maulik Shah and Ishira Parikh who are now professional dancers are part of the company. They have performed at the major events and festivals of India and also traveled abroad to present productions of Anart Foundation. Few of the prestigious performances by Anart Foundation are : Udayshankar ballet festival â€“ Jaipur, Delhi, 33rd World Chemistry Olympiad, International design conference, Asian games- Beijing, International kite festival- Ahmedabad, Openeing ceremony Cairo international film festival- Egypt, Dance India â€“ Milapfest â€“ Liverpool, U.K etc  Recognizing this institutionâ€™s high standard and dedication Sangeet Natak Akademi (New-Delhi) has collaborated with Anart Foundation to organize dance events on several occasions. Dept. of culture supports its activities. Anart Foundation is on the panel of ICCR â€“ New-Delhi.  Anart Foundation has gained and preserved the reputation as an institution with great vision, caliber and dedication in the field of art and culture.

name: Andhjan Kalyan Trust
Details of Achievements: Andhjan Kalyan Trust is a non-profiting and non governmental organization working for the all round development and welfare of the disabled since 1992. This organization though works in the semi developed area of Saurashtra region of Gujarat State of India. It functions nationally and internationally when and where any necessity arises in the cause of the disabled. Initially though Andhjan Kalyan Trust was setup for the welfare of the blind, it felt a great need to undertake educational and rehabilitation programmes for the welfare of the other categories of disabled and hence its started functioning for all the categories of the disabled including Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Mentally Retarded, Orthopaedically Handicapped as well as Multi Handicapped and Cerebral Palsy-Stricken people. To materialize our concerns for all these people, the organization has been running several projects including:  1. Computer Education Centre for the Visually Impaired. Achievements: 20 Blind students  2. Talking Book Production Center for the Visually Impaired Achievements: 25 titles  3. Computerized Braille Production Center Achievements: 5000 pages  4. Deaf-blindâ€™s Education and Training Project. Achievements: 23 Deafblinds persons  5. Community Based Rehabilitation for the Disabled. Achievements: Identified 2898 disabled persons  6. Residential Care Centre for the welfare of persons with Autism, Cerebral palsy, Mentally Retardation and Multiple Disabilities at Dhoraji.  Achievements: 31 beneficiaries  7. Physiotherapy Centre. Achievements: 213 patients  8. Sports and Cultural Activities for the Disabled. Achievements: Organized 5 state level sports meet  9. Free distribution of Aids and Appliances to the Disabled.  Achievements: Tricycle-08, Wheelchair-21, Crutches-47, Tape Recorder with 25 cassettes-17, Hearing Aid-11, Braille Typewriter-02, Walking sticks-200, Braille kits-191, M.R. kits-40  10. Guidance and Counseling to the Disabled and their Parents. Achievements: 500  11. Employment and Placement Services.  Achievements: Self employment-06, Government job-08  12. Advocacy for the Disabled. Achievements: 11  13. Personnel Training and Teaching Working for the Disabled. Achievements: 150

name: ANJALI
Details of Achievements: Anjali was founded by a doctor & his microbiologist wife with intentions of utilising their skills & capabalities for the poor & needy. The activities of Anjali started in 1989 in a rented two room clinic which took shape of a 30 bed rural hospital within four years in a 3.5 acre land donated by a local resident. Staff quarters  & Center for community based development action  were added in phases and hospital extended to 50 beds with new operation theatres including a seperate ophthalmic operation theatre. The organisation was given Ashok Gondhia Award for medical services by Young Mens Gandhian Association in year in the year 1996.Presently along with 50 bed Anjali Hospital in village Ranasan a womens programm is another major activity in 42 surrounding interior villages. Anjali was appointed service NGO ( SNGO) under service NGO scheme of Ministry of Health & Family Welfare. Water conservation in form of developing water bodies is under taken since last seven years. Tree plantation is another programm which was added five years back. Youth & children activities including education, sports , vocational guidance ,tutorials ,awareness generation and making them competitive etc.

name: Anjuman E Talimul Muslimeen
Details of Achievements: present the report describing the educational and Social upliftment activities preferred by the ATM, Malekpore is mainly playing a vital role to spread education in region of five district of South Gujarat. The main function of ATM is to proved financial support to needy, poor, backward and deserving minority candidates to study further, candidates from nearly 160 interior villages are getting benefitted, especially for higher and advance education purpose. Anjuman has set up a residential school in Malekpore with boys hostel and lodging facilities, it has a secondary, Higher secondary school (granted) having the strength of 280 students, it has a non granted primary School having  352 Students. The Residential school complex is situated at remote and tribal area, students from suburbs and slum areas get education here.  Nearly 85 % of them are provided free education, lodging, boarding, uniforms, books, note books, medicines and free extra coaching. All the above cited assistances are provided without any discrimination of cast, creed, it is open for all needy and poor students. The ATM also takes part or organizes other social welfare activities such as medical camps, Blood donation camps, vocational guidance seminar, career guidance seminar, orientation seminar for women education, vocational training for women (Tailoring and Embroidery Classes) in various villages.

name: Anmol Education and Charitable Trust
Details of Achievements: Our trust is dedicated to the welfare of women and children in particular, and we work for creating general awareness among women. We are getting government grant for our two multipurpose Women Welfare Centres at Rajkot and Gondal where we provide counselling services to needy women including women living in slums and villages.  We work with the women attached with SHOs of the area, by organizing training camps and make them aware of the problems related to their health and social maters. We provide need-based help to the women in the cases wherein they face the problems like female foeticide, dowry, domestic violence and other social problems prevailing in our society.  While dealing with family disputes we generally try to arrive at a happy solution for both the parties concerned. In case of need, we provide legal assistance to the needy families.  We also get grants under Rajiv Gandhi National Creche Scheme, under which we provide nutritious food, primary medicines and education to the children of 0 to 5 years age at our day-care centre.   Since last three years we have extended the span of our activities and started providing services to HIV Control segment.  Since 2013-2014 we are entrusted with providing services for AIDS Control under the program named   â€œ......â€ which is sponsored and funded by the government of Gujarat/India.  Working under this project, we organize HIV awareness camps regularly, wherein â€˜integral personal communicationâ€™ and â€˜behaviour change communicationâ€™ remain our prime objective. In our health camps, we communicate through personal meetings and with audio video means; such type of counselling helps us in our work of creating awareness about HIV in general and HIV testing and condom promotion activity in particular.  While working for HIV control, our first task is to decide about the target group. After that we put our every effort to reach each and every member of the said group, especially the groups of migrated labourers. We hardly miss any social events in the area under our command and the traditional mela and fair sites or the big wedding events.  Once we mix up with the targeted group, they also try to come nearer to us. And then our real work of educating them about the controlling of the AIDS starts.  The exact data about our meeting with the target groups during every year is communicated to the related authorities by way of regular reports.  Through our social activities, we try to provide help to the needy citizens of our country who live either in slums or in rural areas where they hardly get any proper counselling or help for solving their social problems in general and health problems in particular.

name: Association for Water and Agriculture Management
Details of Achievements: Organization right from its inception has focused on advanced and alternative farming practices to improve the livelihood condition of farmers It has adopted the policy of inclusive growth by encouraging women groups and also small and marginal farmers The key focus areas have remained as follows Advanced and Alternative Agriculture promotion Land and Water Management and development  Capacity Building  Market research and market linkages. Value edition of  agriculture products              AWAM has long term association with NABARD for implementing various projects He organization is working in two states Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh At present AWAM is implementing three watershed projects in Dahod and Chhotaudepur districts under Indo German Watershed Development Project in Gujarat. Apart from it AWAM is also implementing three WADI project in Pavijetpur block of Chhotaudepur district in which it has covering more than 3000 tribal farmers of the district. Accompanied by watershed and wadi development activities we are also promoting organic farming in this area of Gujarat In Bhabhara block of Alirajpur  AWAM is implementing the NISARG WADI project in which we have established 1000 acres fruit orchard land and covered 1000 family AWAM has also worked with Gujarat government water supply department (GWSSB) to provide drinking water facilities in schools and village habitat Under this programme we have covered more than 100 schools and 35 villages under house connectivity AWAM is implementing 54 drinking water schemes in 34 villages of Dahod district which will be going to cover more than 1300 household with the financial assistance of Tribal Sub Plan Dahod  Besides it AWAM has established four farmers producer organization with the support of NABARD by providing required assistance and resources like input, technical knowledge, financial resources and infrastructure in Pavi Jetpur block of Chhoaudepur district. The purpose of establishing FPOs is to enhance productivity and realize higher return for their produce through collective action and to support tribal farmers linked them directly with market so that farmers get good price for their produce. AWAM through its managerial support prepared farmers for running and governing these FPOs in future  AWAM has recently take responsibility of construction and maintenance of eight vegetable collection centers in Chhotaudepur district under Vanbandhu Kalyan Yojana announced by Tribal development department Gujarat.  AWAM has successfully scaled up its activities in natural resource sector with a clear vision and planning. Sustainability of the organization is highly dependent on its vision and growth plan. AWAM being established with a purpose and communities have given much great response to its initiatives with huge amount of peoples contribution it is sure that the activities and organization are moving towards greater sustainability.

Key Issues.Operational Area-District: GUJARAT->Dohad  , Vadodara, MADHYA PRADESH->Alirajpur, Jhabua, GUJARAT->Panch Mahals, Narmada, Chhotaudepur
